channel.title: One question
channel.description:
ok i fixed my compiler..i have jdk6u1 and so i renamed it so compiler works now.. has :note stream.java uses or overrides a deprictred API then:note recompile with -Xlint: deprication for details then it says press a key w/e
then i try to run my server thing here the problem.. java is not recognized as a external or internal command..im using that tutorial but i think that line is wrong for me since i have a update..this one java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server because i have new update of jdk...what should i put in.. i think 3.0.17 is wrong..idk
sorry for puttin on wrong spot last time

item.title: One question
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Okay, update that no-ip on DUC… Then re-start your internet browser and log back into mopar webclient (not in your server yet). Minimize, open up 7-Zip or WinRar, (whatever you’re using),
and compile (close window), then runserver (minimize), and log into your default 127.0.0.1 and switch the port from FILE to whatever port you have. Also, make sure that if you have a new port its allowed in Firewall in the Exceptions Tab.

Hope this helps.
~ Play N Skillz

Read full topic

item.title: One question
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

I’m back. Haven’t gone on to MSN yet, though.
How do you know its up? Have you put it on server status?

First, log in with default I.P. (127.0.0.1) and then log out. Then, go to your characters file and you should see your name there ____.txt . Click that and change the player rights to whatever you want and so on…

Then, try logging in through your no-ip and port and it should work.

Read full topic

item.title: One question
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Okay, going for the night, will add you tomorrow on MSN.

Put this in compile.bat

@echo off COLOR 08 title Client "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin/java.exe" server pause

And this in runserver.bat

@echo off @color 1f title Server compiler echo Starting "YOURSERVERNAMEHERE" "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe" server pause

Night, man
Hope that helps.

~Play N Skillz

Read full topic

item.title: One question
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

No, you have to register it on server status page. You click compile… then when it says starting ___server on 0.0.0.0.5555 , you close that screen

Then, click on runserver.bat and when thats done, minimize it, then log in mopar webclient with no-ip address and port number.

item.title: One question
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Well, yes that means its connecting your server to the port , which is 5555.
I hate to say, but there’s alot of things you have to do, before its ONLINE for the public to enjoy.

Maybe your friend knows what I’m talking about
Well you have to:

-Port forward
-Get your router I.P., log in and set your rule for your server
-Get a no-ip address for your server at www.no-ip.com
-Update your no-ip on DUC
-Lastly, make sure your port is available in the exceptions tab in your firewall

When you have all that completed, compile, runserver, and put ur no-ip address in server i.p. on mopar webclient and put your port in, and use any username and password desired.

It takes awhile, but its all worth it, trust me.
I will add you on MSN and I wish you the best of luck with your server and getting those tasks
accomplished.

~ Play N Skillz

Read full topic

item.title: One question
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Yes, that means you have to set a Variable named “PATH” which you can learn how to do, in “The Ultimate Server Guide”

Here’s how you get to setting variables:
start menu --> control panel --> system -> advanced --> enviromental variables
NOTE: you can also delete the “classpath” variable, as it is not required.

Read this guide for more information if you haven’t already

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: One question
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Yup, the compiler is correct, that’s what its supposed to say
However, the runserver is wrong…

Erase everything and put this in your runserver.bat file

@echo off COLOR 08 title Client "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin/java.exe" server pause

Then compile again, and double-click runserver.bat and it should work…

Read full topic
